column3: Does the resulting executable actually work 100%.  There were some problems which I cant recall at the moment which cause the move off of vc.\n

It works fine when built without UPnP, but building without UPnP requires a slight modification to net.cpp. I am building without UPnP because I have been unable to make a successful build of MiniUPnP in Visual C++. I'll keep working on that, and let you know if I solve it.\n

Good new: UPnP works fine using the prebuilt DLL. Bad news: I have been building against an old (0.3.23) copy of the source. It looks like I'll need to do a bit more to get things working with the current Git tree.\n
Okay, I successfully got it to build the latest tree, with one issue: Visual C++ doesn't accept that CKeyStore::AddKey doesn't return a value. I had to add a return statement to get it to compile\n
